issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Resource ARN in Policy Doesn't Follow AWS Behavior

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: "MalformedPolicyDocument: AssumeRole policy must contain principals." Should Be Returned When Using Incorrect Trust Policy File During IAM Role Creation

comments.body:
This appears to be a tools issue as the correct error is being logged to cloud-debug.log
{code}
Thu Sep 4 10:32:04 2014 DEBUG [PolicyParser:Euare.23] net.sf.json.JSONException: Element Principal or NotPrincipal is required

Would you please provide the output of this command when run with --debug?  The error it displays comes directly from the server's response.

[~gholms] Got you Garret this is not a tools issue the wrong error is being passed in from the CLC. I will move this bug to the Eucalyptus project.
[~sjones] Thanks, I will take a look at all euare commands that add policies as well.

Code Review Request : EUCA-9970 MalformedPolicyDocument error should contain error message instead of policy text

branch : dev/mmunn1/EUCA-9970

diff :  git show --color ad608e177e6eb72c05f932e87314a437f68d2a56

Summary: Several euare policy handleing commands return the text of the the policy instead of a the error message when a MalformedPolicyDocument
          error is thrown.
          

Solution: : I have changed these to return the error message instead od the policy text.

Unit test : described in comments, I have created a Eutester testcase for this issue at: /eutester/testcases/cloud_admin/4-1/EUCA-9970
[~sjones], please take a look at [~mmunn1]'s suggested fix.
[~mmunn1], the fix looks good to me. Assigning to you so you can approve the patch when the change is in QA.

Verified with build: eucalyptus-cloud-4.1.0-0.0.23001.341.20150114git9d1415a.el6.x86_64
{code}
[root@c-06 sgraham]# euare-roleupdateassumepolicy -r gmoneyrole -f foo.json 
euare-roleupdateassumepolicy: error (MalformedPolicyDocument): Error in uploaded policy: net.sf.json.JSONException: Expecting required element Statement
[root@c-06 sgraham]# euare-rolecreate -r gmoney -f foo.json
euare-rolecreate: error (MalformedPolicyDocument): Error in uploaded policy: net.sf.json.JSONException: Expecting required element Statement
{code}
